entries.title: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried refuses to testify before Senate, committee says
entries.description: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried refused to testify at a Wednesday hearing in front of the Senate Banking Committee.

entries.title: GM, Stellantis rank as worst automakers for fuel efficiency, even amid EV push, EPA says
entries.description: Both automakers decreased their fuel economy and increased C02 emissions since the 2016 model-year, as did Hyundai Motor, Mazda and Volkswagen.

entries.title: Twitter Blue relaunches, now costs $11 per month if you subscribe from an iPhone
entries.description: Twitter relaunched its updated Twitter Blue subscription service Monday after the company's new owner Elon Musk pulled and delayed the launch in November.

entries.title: Consumer inflation expected to have continued cooling in November but still high
entries.description: Consumer inflation likely cooled in November, but prices continue to rise at a still high rate, particularly for services.

entries.title: Elon Musk is no longer the richest person in the world
entries.description: Bernard Arnault is now the richest man in the world, dethroning Tesla CEO Elon Musk after a continued decline in Tesla share price, according to Forbes.

entries.title: New FTX CEO to tell Congress that bankrupt crypto exchange had an 'utter failure of corporate controls'
entries.description: FTX CEO John J. Ray III plans to testify before the House Financial Services Committee on Tuesday.

entries.title: Police in China arrest gang who laundered $1.7 billion via crypto even after Beijing's crackdown
entries.description: Police in China arrested 63 people accused of laundering as much as 12 billion Chinese yuan ($1.7 billion) via cryptocurrency Tether.

entries.title: Iran executes second protester after rapid trial as EU plans more sanctions
entries.description: Iran has long held what activists and other governments say are sham trials in order to imprison or execute critics of the state.

entries.title: Trust between the West and Russia has been destroyed, NATO chief says
entries.description: Russia continues to pound Ukraine's energy infrastructure too with devastating consequences for civilians.

entries.title: Elon Musk booed by crowd after Dave Chapelle brings him on stage at comedy gig
entries.description: Musk's appearance at a Dave Chappelle show in San Francisco was met with a chorus of boos from the crowd.

entries.title: Rivian pauses plans to make electric vans in Europe with Mercedes-Benz
entries.description: Rivian said it remains open to exploring future work with Mercedes-Benz "at a more appropriate time."

entries.title: Microsoft buys near 4% stake in London Stock Exchange and launches 10-year partnership
entries.description: U.S. tech giant Microsoft on Monday announced a 10-year partnership with the London Stock Exchange and took a near 4% stake in the U.K. bourse operator.

entries.title: Danish bioscience firms Novozymes and Chr. Hansen to merge
entries.description: Novozymes and Chr. Hansen have agreed to merge in a massive deal for the Danish biotech sector.

entries.title: Inflation has peaked — but it's not returning to pre-Covid levels in 2023, Mastercard says
entries.description: It'll take a few years to return to 2019 levels, said David Mann of the Mastercard Economics Institute.

entries.title: Putin's old EU ally Orban is once again aggravating Brussels with knockbacks
entries.description: Hungary is blocking new financial support for Ukraine as the country attempts to wrestle free its own EU funds.

entries.title: Europe's power crisis has 'very little to do with Putin,' portfolio manager says
entries.description: Lekander's comments come at a time of huge disruption within global energy markets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February.

entries.title: Southeast Asian markets are in for a 'bungee jump' in 2023, says JPMorgan
entries.description: The region's markets are likely to plunge before surging in the second half of 2023, according to JPMorgan analysts.

entries.title: Cramer: Apple, Amazon, Microsoft and Google will fuel the next rally — but not in the usual way
entries.description: Unlike the trillions that vanished into thin crypto air, the money for the next upswing will come from four stocks with a combined $6 trillion to donate.

entries.title: What do hotel 'star' ratings really mean? Here's a breakdown
entries.description: One hotel can be rated three, four and even five stars — that's because ratings are "not regulated in a consistent way across the industry," one insider says.
